ags:resource.dc:title: Effects of global climate change on agriculture

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: Effects of global climate change on agriculture

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Effects of global climate change on agriculture and ecosystems conditions is infinitely large. Some scientists believe that increased amount of carbon dioxide in atmosphere and temperature increases will have positive affects on plants, but further increases in temperature and moisture deficits will have a negative effects on agricultural crops. Climate change results are already noticeable on grain and grapes for example. Simulated experiments made possible to predict warming results, which is unfavorable and humanity will be facing many problems in future.
